alert.note: Alert for Butler; Chase; Greenwood (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 20 at 5:14AM CDT by NWS Wichita
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Chase, southeastern Butler and Greenwood Counties through 600 AM CDT... At 514 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 11 miles southeast of Cottonwood Falls to near El Dorado. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... El Dorado, Augusta, Eureka, Leon, Madison, Hamilton, Severy, Fall River, Rosalia, Cassoday, Bazaar, Climax, Virgil, Matfield Green, Eureka City Lake, El Dorado State Park, Eureka Airport, Thrall, El Dorado Lake and Fall River State Park. This includes Interstate 35 between Mile Markers 66 and 116. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 AM CDT for east central Kansas.
